messages.message:
Team, this happens frequently on all environments but today it has happened at least 10 or 12 times and it’s kind of frustrating. While I’m working in refiner, at some point, all windows for that environment will just crash.

So if I have the filesystem up, a script window for editing a functions py file, and other items - they will all come to this screen. What this means is that if I’m not saving frequently in refiner, my changes will be lost but it also means that I have to re-load all the windows that crashed as well as re-run all fields in that refiner. I typically lose at least ten minutes every time this happens and I’m pretty sure I’m not the only one this happens to.

Do we know why this happens?

Note: in this screenshot, only the rbc sandbox windows are going down but the demo-2 windows are still up and running. As far as I can tell, this only seems to happen when I am actively working in refiner and it will kill all tabs for that environment (in this case rbc but I have seen it in all environments)
Do you happen to know what you do in refiner that leads to the hang and crash?
I'm curious if it ever has anything to do with re-running a single field in a refiner with a lot of records.
Hi @Travis I am re-running the same field a few times - iterative adding of functionality and whatnot. It’s only 20 records though.

I had noticed at one point that re running a field passes back all of the previous fields in the request which can possibly send a ton of data over the network call. This can cause some big slow downs.

it also isn’t just a random occurrence, it happens almost daily when working within a refiner. Not sure if it’s a Chrome thing but I have been working in firefox without much issue over the last hour or so
I can't remember if the record count matters or rather the field data size.
Ok I'll circle back next week to see what's up.
okey dokey, thanks for checking in
